Notes

[Eric Vigoda]

Dynamic Programming

We do not want to recompute the solutions to the small sub-problems.

Longest Increasing Subsequence

Input: n numbers a_1, a_2, ..., a_n Goal: Find length of LIS in above sequence.

Start by thinking of what could be a sub-problem. Also mathematically formalize it. Call L[i] the LIS for subsequence a[0]...a[i]. Then, think if you know the answer to smaller subproblems, how can you construct answer to a bigger problem. How can you find L[i] given you know L[i-k] for all `k

0. Easier problems are simple. They might require knowledge of only L[i-1]`.

So, we come up with this:

L[i] = L[i - 1] if a[i] <= a[i - 1] else L[i - 1] + 1.

Solve Longest Increasing Subsequence and Longest Increasing Substring problems.
